TopicTitle: [1.2.1] Outer Planets Mod (2.1) - Active development has moved, see first post for new thread

Articles.Content: Congrats on the update! they always seem to happen on the days I check in. Is Ovok finally working how you envisioned it?

This is my CustomAsteroids config. I'm posting this here because I'm having a busy life and I don't have time to make a thread for it. Now, onto the notes and stuff. This is NOT official in any way, shape, or form. Official support was dropped 2 updates ago. As such, this is mainly made for anyone who has CustomAsteroids and OPM, but wants support back unofficially. This is released under the MIT license and redistributes CustomAsteroids by Starstrider. All credit goes to CaptRobau and Starstrider42 for OPM and CustomAsteroids, respectively.

Kerbal Stuff download:

https://kerbalstuff.com/mod/953/OPM%20CustomAsteroids%20Config

Everything else you need to know is at the download site. Thanks for reading.

I'm leaving for holiday, so you won't hear much from me for a week.

Oh, and 1.7.1 introduced a big easter egg. Go and find it!
Does this mod work if i install it on a started savegame?

I'm leaving for holiday, so you won't hear much from me for a week.

have fun capt, I'm stuck at work untill september... maybe even october -.-

Oh, and 1.7.1 introduced a big easter egg. Go and find it!

A new update for the Regolith configs (v6) to add resources to Tal. DOWNLOAD

  • Added Water to Tal (because it's covered in ice)
  • Added MetallicOre to Tal's Impact Basin

99.99999999% an atm issue, try looking into atm cache files. the pink usually comes out when ksp crashes on the first ATM load of new textures, the cache gets corrupted and displayed as pink

I have the same issue, but disabling ATM didn't remove the pink rings (and brought my starting memory to 3.8GB...). It only seems to be caching ribbons for OPM anyway.

Anyone else have pink rings and figured out how to fix it?

With the new update, ovok disappears as I near it, it is visible in map view, but I tried to land on it today and the surface vanished as I entered orbit range. I tried to land with mechjeb but my craft exploded when i touched the invisible surface, even though I was only traveling 5m/s with the landing gear out. Any ideas?
Is Tekto working fine for everyone here? Because I still have the black surface bug and am just wondering whether it is my tweaking or some old bug that causes it...

I just installed this on my 1.01 game, put a ship into orbit around Tekto, and the game won't let me load that ship from the space center -- it locks up the game if I try. Other ships around stock non-OPM bodies still work fine. (But in map view I also can't switch to the Tekto ship.) Is this a known problem or some unique mess I've created?

Update: I restored from my last quicksave and it worked for a while, but I kept running into the same thing. I've uninstalled OPM & restored my pre-OPM save, I'll see if I encounter the same problem around any stock planets. Maybe 1.01 is just too old?

Edited July 7, 2015 by Markarian421
Just stopping by to point out that the delta-v map has been updated, OPM included.
Do you know what changed?
Regarding the issue between Rings and EVE clouds, especially for Urlum: Using Kittopia to generate the rings instead of Kopernicus resolves it.

I have some problems installing OPM, I believe I have copied the files in the correct folder, but I cant see any of the planets when I start KSP and go to the tracking station. I have taken a screenshot of the gamedata folder: http://imgur.com/4rlaPUc The files should be in the correct directory, can anybody tell me what I have done wrong/need to do in order to get OPM working?
You don't have Kopernicus installed.

I have some problems installing OPM, I believe I have copied the files in the correct folder, but I cant see any of the planets when I start KSP and go to the tracking station. I have taken a screenshot of the gamedata folder: http://imgur.com/4rlaPUc The files should be in the correct directory, can anybody tell me what I have done wrong/need to do in order to get OPM working?

You need to install Kopernicus in addition to OPM. Make sure you install kopernicus correctly:

- put the content of the GameData folder you find in the archive inside your own GameData folder

- Don't use the folder Kopernicus Examples (unless you want to see what those do)

for OPM to work you need at least:

.../KSP/GameData/OPM

.../KSP/GameData/Kopernicus

.../KSP/GameData/Squad

.../KSP/GameData/ModuleManager.x.x.x.dll

Edited July 7, 2015 by Sigma88
Thanks - it works now I thought that the lines after "It incorporates the following mods:" meant that they were already in the zip files with OPM... my mistake. Thanks for the help guys

I know this is probably not related to OPM (at least not directly), but there is a giant dust fog right in front of Moha. I've checked the .cfg files for dust particles and there is no reference to Moha in them. Strange. Not a major problem, but does anyone have a clue?
Astronomers Visual Pack? It is supposed to mimic the solar wind's interaction with the surface I reckon...
Yeah if you open up the EVE menu you can change the intensity, rotation speed, altitude etc. of that effect to your liking. Nothing to do with OPM though.

Hey, is tekto still dark? And is tal still impossible to walk on? Because maybe he forgot to update the OP, seeing as he is on vacation. Really, those 2 bugs are the only reason I haven't installed this incredible mod already, so it would be very kind if someone could check them out.

Hey, is tekto still dark? And is tal still impossible to walk on? Because maybe he forgot to update the OP, seeing as he is on vacation. Really, those 2 bugs are the only reason I haven't installed this incredible mod already, so it would be very kind if someone could check them out.

I don't have any problem with Tekto but Tal is impossible to walk, I didn't tried out the new dll yet.

FIY, if you want to update to Kopernicus 0.2 - ONLY copy the .dll, NOT the .cfg's!
